findings.title: Best Practice Violation: Unchecked Transfer
findings.description: The function rebalance() does not use the SafeERC20 library for checking the result of ERC20 token transfers, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: M11. State Variables Should Be Declared Constant
findings.description: Declare state variables as constant to reduce gas costs.

findings.title: Requirements Violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: An attacker could interact with the router and provide incorrect token prices in case of a Dark Oracle account compromise.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: The function getCoinToStrategy() performs two loops that access storage. The number of iterations of the loop is uncontrolled as it depends on the length of the state variable coinToStrategy[coin]. Eventually, the state variable can be long enough to reach the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: The code does not follow the established style guide, which may lead to inconsistencies and potential security issues.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: Requirements Violation

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: C01. Data Consistency
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: C02. Access Control Violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: H01. Data Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: H02. Denial of Service
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: H03. Highly Permissive Role; Data Consistency
findings.description: Highly permissive role can lead to data consistency issues.

findings.title: H04. Highly Permissive Role; Assets Integrity
findings.description: Funds are protected and cannot be withdrawn without proper permissions or be locked on the contract.

findings.title: H05. Data Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: H06. Data Consistency; Race Condition
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: H07. Data Consistency; Highly Permissive Role
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow and ensure roles are not overly permissive.

findings.title: H08. Highly Permissive Role; Assets Integrity
findings.description: Highly permissive role can compromise assets integrity by allowing unauthorized access or manipulation of funds.

findings.title: H09. Invalid Calculations; Requirements Violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: M24. Missing Event for Critical Value Update
findings.description: The function setFee() and setFeeDenominator() do not emit relevant events when updating fee and feeDenominator.

findings.title: M02. Missing Event for Critical Value Update
findings.description: Events should be emitted after sensitive changes take place, to facilitate tracking and notify off-chain clients following the contract’s activity.

findings.description: The function setFee() does not emit relevant events when updating fee and the function setFeeDenominator() does not emit relevant events when updating feeDenominator.
